entry.title: v4l2: Secure buffer allocation and attaching to DecoderBuffer
entry.content:
Adds allocation of secure buffers for each buffer in the V4L2 OUTPUT

queue when in secure playback mode. This is an async call, so it happens

during init of the queue and V4L2Decoder blocks invoking the init

callback until all allocations have completed or failure occurs.



The VideoDecoderPipeline will call into V4L2VideoDecoder to attach

secure buffers to DecoderBuffers and also to release them when the

DecoderBuffer is done using it. In a follow up CL, we will be submitting

the corresponding secure buffers into the actual V4L2Queue.



BUG=b:248610914

TEST=Secure playback works w/ full prototype on tomato



Change-Id: Ia558f5d2ef4cb4c4769f445b96a240df36c66485

entry.title: Reland "[wpt-metadata] Refine updates for `chrome` and `debug`"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 0f05c7e5dad22d2c2d0454bde0bcc030cf25e1cf



Changes since original:

`manifestupdate` also evaluates existing `expected`, so the old

property filtering was too aggressive. Relax this by only filtering

to all usable properties, and only filter to update properties when

deciding what results to fill in. This implements a kind of

expectation inheritance, which will be useful for `--reset-results`

(crbug.com/1480061).



Original change's description:

> [wpt-metadata] Refine updates for `chrome` and `debug`

>

> * Do not generate any `chrome` configurations with nonempty

> `virtual_suite`, as `chrome` will not run virtual tests.

> * Remove `debug` as an update property when no debug builders are

> present, as debug builders are usually CI-only and therefore can't be

> used to set expectations against a CL. In that case, automatically

> extend the release results to the debug counterpart, which are usually

> identical. This mimics how the WPT importer doesn't add

> TestExpectations with a `Debug` specifier.

> * Remove the implicit unused `subsuite` property [1], which interferes

> with updates.

>

> [1]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/e357f7f9/tools/wptrunner/wptrunner/testloader.py#L115

>

> Bug: 1152503

> Fixed: 1478884

> Change-Id: I0e0b8c55d76f185076f059bd6d99298b945ddc38

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4836551

> Commit-Queue: Jonathan Lee

> Reviewed-by: Weizhong Xia

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1193176}

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2:V4L2StatefulVD: support H.264 fragment reassembly
entry.content:
H.264 bitstreams can have fragments of full "frames". Evidence and

legacy code points to stateful drivers (at least QC venus) needing

full frames to be enqueued at once. H.264 spec also speaks about that.



This CL teaches the code to use a new H264FrameReassembler class to figure out frame boundaries and to reassemble (concatenate) bunches

of DecoderBuffers into enqueue-able ones. This new class needs to be

plugged in during normal Decode() and also End-of-Stream Decode()

calls, otherwise much of the code remains untouched and this CL is

a massive code addition.



With this, all of the "first_mb_in_slice" test vectors start passing

(e.g. baseline/BA1_FT_C.h264, BASQP1_Sony_C.h264) and also all the

currently failing H264 baseline (but this might be a fluke).



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: If790dbfb599b12642473fc620c027c08e75fc483

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4827186

entry.title: Major overhaul of ExceptionState in the v8 bindings
entry.content:
* Currently, interface.py has a mechanism for calculating the

appropriate ExceptionContext::Context type, but named and indexed

interceptors generally have hard-coded values. Plumb the

information required to use the general mechanism.

* Rename a bunch of ExecutionContext::Context types, so that it's

easier to generate the correct type in the bindings and we use

more consistent names throughout.

* As part of updating the named and indexed interceptors to use the

general ExceptionState construction mechanism, remove the large

blocks of code pasted into those interceptors and break them up

in to a proper tree of code nodes in the bindings generator.

* Named and indexed interceptors are different from most other

bindings in that the relevant property name is dynamically

provided by script, rather than being a string literal known by

the bindings generator. This requires that ExceptionContext be

able to handle property names that are not string literals. This

is accomplished by having ExceptionContext have the option of

holding a WTF::String that backs the property name, in order to

ensure the c-string property name is kept alive for the entire

lifetime of the ExceptionContext.

* The consumers of the ExceptionContext::property_name_ will

eventually want the property name as a WTF::String, so change

ExceptionContext::GetPropertyName() to return a WTF::String. This

will either return the interceptor property name string directly,

or wrap a string literal in a String before returning it.

* We now plumb enough information to actually report the property

name in exception for named and indexed interceptors. Update the

error messages and associated test expectations.



Change-Id: Ia164d60fb30ec9ed68a6cdae25b104589f4a16c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4808884

Reviewed-by: Andrey Kosyakov

Commit-Queue: Nate Chapin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1193846}

entry.title: Consider nested snap areas on layout snaps
entry.content:
When snapping after a layout change, we snap to the

scroll-snap-align-specified position. This may cause unwanted jumps

in the case of large snap areas, e.g. when android shows browser

controls.

For large snap areas (areas larger than the snapport) we should,

instead, consider snapping to the closest covering position.

This is the behavior for snaps that occur at the end of a scroll.

This patch makes snaps after layout changes conform to this behavior.



Large snap areas may contain nested snap areas which may themselves be large snap areas that contain nested snap areas, so this patch

accounts for this by looking at all snap areas that overlap with the

snap area we are attempting to snap to.



A few notes about the test changes:



snap-area-overflow-boundary.html & changing-scroll-snap-align.html:

the first test cases now takes into account that the relayout

doesn't reset the scroll position.

A test case is also added for changing-scroll-snap-align.html verifying the behavior of small snap targets.

entry.title: Add encoding and newline to open calls
entry.content:
For maximum portability the Chromium Python style guide recommends using

newline='' when writing text files (to avoid Windows-style line endings)

and encoding='utf-8' for reading and writing text files. This change

updates ui/webui/resources/tools to follow this convention.



There are no known problems with this particular set of open calls.

This change is being done for preventive maintenance, and to set a

good example for anybody who copies this code.

entry.title: cros: shill: add UMA histograms for portal detection durations
entry.content:
This patch defines the UMA histogram for the following ChromeOS portal

detection metrics:

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.HTTPProbeDuration.$TECH: duration in

milliseconds of HTTP probes done for network validation.

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.HTTPSProbeDuration.$TECH: duration in

milliseconds of HTTPS probes done for network validation.

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.InternetValidationDuration.$TECH: total

duration in milliseconds of a network validation attempt confirming

Internet connectivity.

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.PortalDiscoveryDuration.$TECH: total

duration in milliseconds of a network validation attempt obtaining a

portal redirection result.

entry.title: Remove some buildflag checks around touch text editing feature.
entry.content:
The CrOS touch text editing redesign feature is mainly planned for

ChromeOS, but parts of the implementation have been added in shared

code. Expose the flag so that we can investigate whether parts of the

feature could also be added to other platforms as well.



Also remove one buildflag check around a switch that sets the touch text

selection strategy to "direction" (i.e. "expand by word, shrink by

character" behaviour). The touch-text-editing-redesign flag is still

disabled by default for non-ChromeOS platforms, so this shouldn't affect

default behaviour on other platforms.

entry.title: Only create AXObjects while processing deferred events
entry.content:
By restricting this, the number of potential patterns is reduced,

making Blink a11y more predictable.



As a follow-up, we could consider making GetOrCreate() a private

entry.title: Add Notification Origins to Referrer Chain
entry.content:
Design: go/crca-add-notification-origins-to-referrer-chains



The ServiceWorkerVersion notifies observers about a new tab being opened

or an existing tab being navigated. The

SafeBrowsingNavigationObserverManager implements the

ServiceWorkerContextObserver to be notified of these events. When

notified, SBNOM creates new NavigationEvents that are considered for

inclusion in the ReferrerChain.



Output from manual testing can be seen here:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6im9QSYqt26yFPu

entry.title: arc-tracing: clean up any unused exo tracing
entry.content:
Remove unused exo events and code relying on them. This means deleting

input event tracing logic, which was only used by arc-graphics-tracing.



This is a follow-up to https://crrev.com/c/4596657, which disabled

chrome://arc-graphics-tracing, but did not quite get rid of all the code

that supported it.



This CL does not intend to completely remove the vestigial code either.

This is just in preparation for switching Exo event tracking from trace

to callbacks, so this CL is intended to remove some of the

TRACE_EVENT-specific code that we aren't planning to convert.



arc-power-control has a "Chrome graphics" chart which appears broken

before this CL. This does not use the removed events but kGpuPower and

kGpuFrequency.

entry.title: Remove DCHECK on IBAN value as it might be empty under some circumstances
entry.content:
This CL fixes a debug crash when the IBAN value is empty. It can be

empty when Chrome saves an IBAN with the keychain locked, resulting in

it crashing every time on startup.



If value_ had a length of 0, the DCHECK makes it crash, so this prevents

that code path.



Additionally, IBAN validation has been added at set_value() so only

valid IBAN values can be added (validation check is here:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/data_model/iban.cc;drc=554d54a93697d889655a178d6f122d01b4de7280;l=290), so it should be safe to remove the DCHECK when the

value is empty.



Bug: 1479821

entry.title: [GridNG] Update test expectation for grid-template-shorthand-valid.html
entry.content:
Per https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom/#serializing-css-values "If component

values can be omitted or replaced with a shorter representation without

changing the meaning of the value, omit/replace them."



This means that when serializing `grid-template-*`, we should always

omit `auto` sizes in `grid-template-*` serialization as it is the

default value, so it will always be a shorter representation

without changing the value. This should happen regardless of whether

it was specified by the author.



This means that the final test case expectation in

grid-template-shorthand-valid.html is incorrect. It is also failing in

Blink/Gecko/WebKit for this exact reason, so this CL updates the test's

expected behavior to omit `auto`. After this change, it passes

everywhere.



Bug: 1028283

Change-Id: I640f450e50df45c404b46c17c2d9cdce49313c60

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4851233

entry.title: Mac immersive: fix zoom bubble and tests
entry.content:
When immersive fullscreen is enabled on Mac, content fullscreen sits on top of it. It's controversial whether this design should be kept, but it's here now and difficult to change.



This change:

- Fixes zoom bubble anchoring by explicitly turning it off for content

fullscreen on Mac

- Fixes related tests both by the substantive change above and

- Turning off the check that the immersive controller is disabled

for content fullscreen on Mac

- Turning off the immersive flag for a test that relies on behavior

that is impossible on immersive



Low-Coverage-Reason: Code path only hit in Mac immersive fullscreen, will be covered when we can land https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4828010

Validate-Test-Flakiness: skip

Bug: 1477825, 1477397

entry.title: Invert order of steps for running clang-tidy
entry.content:
Forgetting to change directories before running `gn gen .` will spray

the current directory with a bunch of random directories and files.

Switching the order of these commands makes it a bit safer to copy and

paste or reverse-search shell history without fully reading the

instructions. :)



Change-Id: Iff38edcba90d8fd0686b56af7ad6be3f25b5c4b1

Reason for revert: This seems to be the root cause of build failures on official ChromeOS builders - see b/299483903 and https://logs.chromium.org/logs/chrome/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8770647278023710993/+/u/compile/stdout



Original change's description:

> [reland] Enable *building* Rusty QR Code Generation on ChromeOS.

>

> This is a reland of a subset of https://crrev.com/c/4684489. The

> `browser_tests` ODR issues no longer repro after

> https://crrev.com/c/4770194. Original CL description follows with

> a few minimal tweaks.

>

> This CL is similar to https://crrev.com/c/4632898,

> https://crrev.com/c/4667673, and https://crrev.com/c/4679757 which

> enabled building of Rusty QR Code Generation on Android, Windows, and

> other platforms. *This* CL enables building it on ChromeOS. As with the

> earlier CL, this CL does *not* yet *use* Rusty QR Code Generation at

> runtime, because the "RustyQrCodeGenerator" feature remains disabled by

> default.

entry.title: [omnibox][actions] Update inlining code to left-justify action chip row.
entry.content:
One of the major goals of the Actions UI Simplification work is to

inline the action chips associated with suggestions in the Omnibox.

While crrev.com/c/4789492 laid the groundwork for this by switching the

relevant FlexLayout to a horizontal orientation, the actual action chip

row was being right-justified, which did not match the design spec.



In order to align this UI with the spec, this CL updates various bits of

UI code so that the action chip row is now properly left-justified

following the suggestion text views (content, description, etc.). This

CL also ensures that the resultant row is now consistent in height with

all other suggestion rows.



BEFORE this CL:

- header - flag disabled: http://screen/8PSXouhwP5P2Fja

- header - flag enabled: http://screen/7PVX6LPpvoQ7KNg



- suggestion w/ chip - flag disabled: http://screen/B4tnPzcrJGaonjc

- suggestion w/ chip - flag enabled: http://screen/AA9yDJACWYgJSPN



AFTER this CL:

- header - flag disabled: http://screen/9VcpBDEByB5yoxL

- header - flag enabled: http://screen/65pBnywq2iBhZuT



- suggestion w/ chip - flag disabled: http://screen/6akpwGUfUpPN4sB

- suggestion w/ chip - flag enabled: http://screen/9ae5Q9F5jPFtMRu



Bug: 1473164

Change-Id: I757b7c5ee5d1786a21ecd4c9438e4c6b630fc873

Low-Coverage-Reason: This CL is part of an experiment (which is in the very initial stages of implementation) being done to further simplify the Omnibox UI (i.e. it's not guaranteed to launch).

entry.title: OCMock: Remove usage of object_getClass in OCMArg.
entry.content:
resolveSpecialValues in OCMArg currently calls object_getClass to verify

if an object is OCMPassByRefSetters, but this may crash on newer

devices, as the pointer referenced may not always be an objective-c

object.



Since all resolveSpecialValues cares about is OCMPassByRefSetters,

instead cache each OCMPassByRefSetter on initialization and check the

cache later.



Thanks to dmac@ for providing this patch.



This is a reland of https://crrev.com/c/3011651



Bug: 1478147

Change-Id: Ic0bd93142681611aedf50992a1c6c945f2c10606

This change was originally reverted because it was breaking Google TTS.

The reason is because the chromiumos side had not been updated. This

change can be safely relanded (since we just started M119) as long as

the following change is also landed at the same time:



https://crrev.com/c/4826255



Original change's description:

> TTS: Modify TTS service to work with XNNPack (part 2)

>

> This change is the second half of fixing the TTS - XNNPack bug.

> This change does several things:

>

> 1. Calls GoogleTtsPreSandboxInit (added in an internal change),

> which explicitly initializes cpuinfo. This is done because cpuinfo

> is needed by some XNNPack code within libchrometts.so.

> 2. Gives the TTS service permission to call getcpu, which is used on

> arm64. Without this change, TTS doesn't work on arm64.

> 3. Removes the read permission to /proc/cpuinfo, which was initially

> added to address b:269146620 on x86_64. This was a temporary fix

> and is now unnecessary given the above two changes. See this design

> doc [1] for more details.

>

> [1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pU8hRzE0Z_eph-MeVYv_EWlbtrRhxXmHEwHbtPVoXhM/edit?usp=sharing

>

> (from fig client) # Run script to deploy Google TTS

> (from chrome-sdk) autoninja -C out_${SDK_BOARD}/Release chrome nacl_helper

> (from chrome-sdk) deploy_chrome --device=localhost:2224 --build-dir=out_${SDK_BOARD}/Release

> (on device) Turn on ChromeVox and ensure speech output.

>

> Bug: b:269146620,b:296458143

> Test: Manually on x86_64 and arm64.

> Change-Id: Ifc500da14a0f9207cac8e0fb177a8bbddc259489

entry.title: [ThumbnailCapturerMac] Ensure a stable ordering of the picker
entry.content:
When getDisplayMedia() is invoked, the user may choose to share

a window. These windows are presented to the user in a media-picker,

along with the option to share tabs or screens.



Subject to the Finch flags ScreenCaptureKitStreamPickerVentura or

ScreenCaptureKitStreamPickerSonoma, new logic is used to populate

the windows in the media-picker.



Prior to this CL, the order of windows was unstable, and could

be thrown off by random user actions that did not actually change

the contents of the picker. One example is when the user caused

the macOS task bar to appear or disappear - although the task bar

itself was not offered to the user, and although the active

window did not change, the order in the picker did change.

This CL fixes this issue.



One known issue with the current approach is that it loses

the desired property, that the last window the user interacted

with was *usually* the first in the list. Maintaining this

property was less important than avoiding random reordering

of the rest of the picker. This property may be reintroduced

by later CLs.



Bug: 1478172

Change-Id: Ifc79a1b7511476a585eddf1fbb84df1bef78bdcf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4849749

entry.title: [Clank][UX Enhancements] Upstream Save Card Expiration Date Fix UX
entry.content:
This CL adds a new xml layout icon_after_title_view.xml for a custom

title view. The UX enhancement is supported by a feature flag and

affects Upstream Save card expiration date fix dialogs title and

title icon view.



AutofillSaveCardPromptBase uses autofill_save_card_base_layout.xml for

a custom view. To introduce a custom title view, this CL adds a ViewStub

in a parent LinearLayout and puts the LinearLayout with other parts of

dialog below the new ViewStub to not affect the custom title

view with different padding and margin settings.



If the feature flag is enabled AutofillSaveCardPromptBase inflates

that ViewStub with icon_after_title_view.xml else uses the default

title view. This dialog's default title view is set using a

PropertyModel.Builder with ModalDialogProperties.TITLE and

ModalDialogProperties.TITLE_ICON. ModalDialogManager uses

modal_dialog_title.xml for the default title view.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Asgi7HBm3hdH5QX



After: https://storage.mtls.cloud.google.com/chromium-translation-screenshots/Gpay_expiration_date_fix_ux_after.png?authuser=0



Low-Coverage-Reason: WIP CL to add UTs (https://crrev.com/c/4822348).

entry.title: Fix crashes caused by PremierOpinion and RelevantKnowledge software
entry.content:
Multiple crashes have been reported from a network service utility

process with `--service-sandbox-type=network` flag. `pmls64.dll` seems

to be trying to be loaded into network service. There were bugs and

fixes for the similar crashes from mozilla:

- https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1277846

- https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8759697&action=diff



Searched up the same dll list from the Chrome crash report and the

following dlls are observed with either `Unhandled C++ Exception` or

`Access Violation` error:

- pmls64.dll: https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?stbtiq=product%3AChrome%20pmls64.dll

- rlls64.dll: https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?stbtiq=product%3AChrome%20rlls64.dll

- rlls.dll: https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?stbtiq=product%3AChrome%20rlls.dll

- prls64.dll: https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?stbtiq=product%3AChrome%20prls64.dll

- opls64.dll: https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?stbtiq=product%3AChrome%20opls64.dll



Those dlls should not be loaded into the network service.



Bug: 1378128

Change-Id: Ieb3cd6e2899c2896aaf785dccac6670c31e0418e

entry.title: [A11y] Remove loop in ProcessDeferredAccessibilityEventsImpl()
entry.content:
Perform all work in one pass.



In order to achieve this, some changes to the ignored computation for

whitespace were necessary, so that they are not invalidated during the work in ProcessDeferredAccessibilityEventsImpl():

1. Do not process spaces at the end of the document when the document is only partially loaded, because the context of what comes after the space is necessary.

2. Space should not be ignored next to an image. We cannot rely on a LayoutImage check because an unloaded image is not yet a LayoutImage. This also caused flakiness in tests that have whitespace next to an image. A DOM check has been added. The LayoutImage check is still necessary for pseudo element images.

3. Once a whitespace decision is made, memoize the decision. This helps provide consistency while reducing complexity, as subtrees of block elements do not need to be recomputed when any inline within them changes.



Another change relates to content-visibility. Previously we did not receive a signal when that style changed. A variety of other small changes are explained in code or CL comments.



Bug: none

Change-Id: I9e3007c1679d2cd36acfce2d7f9fdc8466bab924

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4528195

Reviewed-by: Jacques Newman

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

entry.title: [iOS] Display permission request dialog on the main thread
entry.content:
This is attempt to fix the crash:

https://crash.corp.google.com/5bcd6b2e74c33cf0



It is suspected that the web view delegate API



- webView:requestMediaCapturePermissionForOrigin:initiatedByFrame:

type:decisionHandler:



is not always invoked on the main thread. This CL patches with a new

block layer so that the helper method displayPromptForPermissions:

withDecisionHandler: is always invoked on the main thread. This isn't

a perfect solution as it captures self in a block; more enhancements

should be made as follow-ups.

entry.title: Enforce non-overlap between IGs and NegativeIGs in joinAdInterestGroup.
entry.content:
This change enforces the policy that interest groups must be distinct

from negative interest groups for efficiency of storage. This is

enforced during the call to joinAdInterestGroup and subsequent updates

by applying the restriction that an InterestGroup can provide a value

for additionalBidKey or ads, but not both.

entry.title: [GridNG] Omit `auto` sizes for `grid-template-*` serialization
entry.content:
Per https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom/#serializing-css-values "If component values can be omitted or replaced with a shorter representation without changing the meaning of the value, omit/replace them."



This means that when serializing `grid-template-*`, we should always omit `auto` sizes in `grid-template-*` serialization as it is the

default value, so it will always be a shorter representation

without changing the value. This should happen regardless of whether

it was specified by the author.



This also means that the final test case expectation in

grid-template-shorthand-valid.html is incorrect, which lead me all over the place on early iterations of this CL. The above

CSSWG quote and the fact that Safari and Firefox fail for the same

reason has me confident that the assertion there is incorrect. I

will update the test to the correct behavior in a follow-up CL.

entry.content:
This reverts commit 0f05c7e5dad22d2c2d0454bde0bcc030cf25e1cf.



Reason for revert: Crashes the importer:

https://logs.chromium.org/logs/infra/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8770623359310274289/+/u/Import_changes_from_WPT_to_Chromium/stdout



Original change's description:

> [wpt-metadata] Refine updates for `chrome` and `debug`

>

> * Do not generate any `chrome` configurations with nonempty

> `virtual_suite`, as `chrome` will not run virtual tests.

> * Remove `debug` as an update property when no debug builders are

> present, as debug builders are usually CI-only and therefore can't be

> used to set expectations against a CL. In that case, automatically

> extend the release results to the debug counterpart, which are usually

> identical. This mimics how the WPT importer doesn't add

> TestExpectations with a `Debug` specifier.

> * Remove the implicit unused `subsuite` property [1], which interferes

> with updates.

>

entry.title: Remove unused party_context computation
entry.content:
The party_context is never actually read anymore, now that the

implementation of the SameParty attribute has been (mostly) removed.

The only remaining reader of the field just cares about whether the

absl::optional is populated for not, so we can replace the field with

a boolean. (Note: I'm open to better names for the boolean, since the

one I picked seems in conflict with

IsolationInfo::CreateForInternalRequest. But I don't have a better

idea.)



Note that this does not touch the IsolationInfo proto's field, since

I can't tell how that's used (and it may be stored on disk).
